title: KKR, partners lower Australia's Latitude IPO price: sources
text:
FILE PHOTO: Trading information for KKR & Co is displayed on a screen on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., August 23, 2018. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

SYDNEY (Reuters) - U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co (KKR.N) and its partners have decided to lower the IPO price of their Australian non-bank lender, Latitude Financial, which is due to list in the local bourse on Friday, by at least 11%, two sources told Reuters.

It is the second attempt at listing Latitude for KKR, Deutsche Bank (DBKGn.DE) and Varde Partners. The trio had filed a prospectus with the regulator last month valuing the finance company at between A$2 and A$2.25 per share.

The new price being offered is about A$1.78 per share, the sources said, asking not to be identified because they were not allowed to talk to the media.

Latitude declined to comment.
description: U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co and its partners have decided to lower the IPO price of their Australian non-bank lender, Latitude Financial, which is due to list in the local bourse on Friday, by at least 11%, two sources told Reuters.
